alert.note: Alert for City of Franklin; City of Suffolk; Greensville; Isle of Wight; Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 12:06PM EDT until September 23 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, City of Franklin, City of Suffolk, Greensville, Isle of Wight and Southampton. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Smithfield, Windsor, Courtland, Boykins, Holland, Downtown Suffolk, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Ivor, Newsoms, Carrsville, Hunterdale, Sedley, Zuni, Kings Fork, Whaleyville, Driver, Rescue and Crittenden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Franklin; City of Suffolk; Greensville; Isle of Wight; Southampton
